content.title: Surgical Avoidance in Vascular EDS
content.description: Principles guiding avoidance of elective surgery in patients with vascular Ehlers-Danlos syndrome

key_concepts.details: Type III collagen deficiency causes extreme tissue fragility, poor wound healing, and arterial friability
Avoid elective vascular surgery whenever possible; monitor and treat conservatively
When surgery unavoidable, use gentle handling, avoid vessel clamping, consider buttressed sutures
Endovascular treatment may cause dissection; if used, minimize catheter manipulation

content.clinical_significance: Operative mortality and morbidity significantly elevated in vEDS patients
